body: Can you provide a reproducible example?

Hello, Chang Zhao.

There is my project https://github.com/niknickolas/task-runner

> Hello, Chang Zhao.
>

> 
> 2016-03-27 5:17 GMT+03:00 Cheng Zhao notifications@github.com:

> > 
> > —
> > You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/4817#issuecomment-201972096
It is impossible to any of us to just debug your app, unless you can make the example minimal so we can obviously see the problem of Electron, otherwise we have to assume it is a bug of your app.

Hello.

Ok, I will change the app for the best test

Hello.

You can test my app but be careful, I set maximum number of working
browsers for
each tube to 50, if you have more memory operation cat you increase this
variable MaxNumberOfWorkingBrowsersForEachtube;

use the access content through a proxy server, for more accurate testing , it
would be better if most ip addresses are non-working, you will get result
faster

/*
- proxy = null; if don't use proxy
- */
  let proxy = {
  address: 'ip:port',
  credentials: ['login', 'password']
  };

/*
- I don't use proxy
- */
  proxy = null;

> > https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/4817#issuecomment-203874887

Following apps are perfect examples of minimal test cases:

https://github.com/nathansobo/disable-renderer-backgrounding-test-case
https://github.com/kamesh-a/electron-samples/tree/master/willDownload
https://github.com/davej/electron-execSync-test

A minimal test case should only include necessary information to show the problem, like, calling a certain API of Electron leaks memory, instead of, your app doing complex things and there is memory leak. The latter mostly sounds like there is bug in your code.

I think, minimal test cases can only show you that api works perfect but
what about if app is working for a long time and doing complex things, only
after that you can see whole result.

I don't say that I am good programmer, yes I can do lot of mistakes. What
is real problem ?
Is it  closure that doesn't let garbage collector do its job or it is some
other thing ?

I  remembered one feature that when I run my application on the server very
quickly ran out of file descriptors, and for this I increased the limit.
May it give you some idea.

What I think zcbenz is trying to say is there are two types of things that can cause issues. The first is a bug in your application and the second is a bug in his application. To show him his bug you would typically find what caused it and make a reproducible example. One that would be a test case interchangeable with other Electron projects and not just yours.

> I think, minimal test cases can only show you that api works perfect but
> what about if app is working for a long time and doing complex things, only
> after that you can see whole result.

If that is the case, I'm afraid no one except yourself will be interested in looking into it.
